titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Theatre Survey Records, 1963-1980 CTC.1977.01
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jean Blanco in 1977 and 1981.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-06-06T12:58-0400

did.unittitle: Theatre Survey Records
did.abstract: Theatre Survey, the official journal of the American Society for Theater Research (ASTR), began publication as an annual journal in 1960. The journal was edited first at Brandeis, then for a few years at Princeton, before it came to the University of Pittsburgh in 1963. The collection is arranged chronologically, and the records include general correspondence, financial records, edited typescripts of published articles with related correspondence, miscellaneous items, and a small amount of ASTR material, most of which is related to subscriptions.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See also Curtis Collection of Pittsburgh Performing Arts Information Files and the periodicals ASTR Newsletter, Membership Directories, and Miscellany.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were transferred from the University of Pittsburgh Theatre Arts Department to the Ford E. and Harriet R. Curtis Theater Collection in 1977 and 1981.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Theatre Survey, the official journal of the American Society for Theater Research, began publication as an annual in 1960. Originally supported by a Brandeis University grant, it was first edited at Brandeis, and for a few years, at Princeton. Beginning in 1963, Theatre Survey, was supported by the University of Pittsburgh and starting with Volume 5, 1964, when it became a semi-annual publication, it was also edited here. Pitt editors included Ralph G. Allen, George E. Bogusch, Attilio Favorini, and Raymond Pentzell. Dr. Favorini has been Executive Editor from 1972.
Editorship of Theatre Survey was transferred from the University of Pittsburgh to State University of New York, Albany campus beginning with Volume 21 in 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Arranged chronologically, the records include general correspondence, financial records, edited typescripts of published articles with related correspondence, etc., and also a small amount of ASTR material, most of which is related to subscriptions. The records are not complete. The records include edited typescripts and related correspondence arranged by volume and issue, miscellaneous correspondence, and ASTR related materials. Miscellaneous financial records, including invoices, subscription records, etc. are in a separate chronological series. The records comprise all those extant from the University of Pittsburgh’s sponsorship of Theatre Survey, 1963-1976.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Jean Blanco in 1977 and 1981. It was entered into Archivists' Toolkit by Christie Graci in May 2010.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Theatre Survey Records, 1963-1980, CTC.1977.01, Curtis Theatre Collection, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh
Theatre Survey Records, 1963-1980, CTC.04, Curtis Theatre Collection, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Theatre Survey Records, 1963-1980, CTC.1977.01, Curtis Theatre Collection, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System
